s0: ^Nevada, 1958. The Hopburg-Steiner was constructed in a military research facility using a technology of unknown origin.
s1: ^Despite being only palm-sized, be assured this is a device of extreme consequence. Mildly radioactive, it is stored inside a beryllium container.
s2: ^In April 1962, an unknown foreign agent exited the lab in Area 51 with the device in a briefcase.

ContainerOpeningBeat: ^The container itself is of no importance. The device within, however, is of the utmost significance.
AgentUnknownBeat: ^The identity of the agent is still unknown, except for one thing: he didn't work for us.
BerlinDeadDrop: ^But I did as I was told to do. For what good it did me.
DroppingBerlinDeadDrop: ^There was never time to think. Only to act.
graveyard: ^I know I loved him. I would have loved him all my life, if I could have.
in_the_kitchens: ^In bad hands, things go badly. It's that simple.
hotel_bathroom: ^I think that's why Ernst died. Someone... gave him... something.
back_alleyway: ^My husband wasn't perfect. Just another poor unfortunate who got in the way.
kingdiamondsclub: ^Because someone tried to change things. To turn them to their own advantage. Only the house always wins.
apartment: ^I told him not to go. But he wouldn't listen. He said this time it would be different.
quentin_passes_note: ^Not every opportunity is worth taking, however well paid.
item_from_quentin: ^But it's hard to tell friends from enemies, sometimes.
king_clubs_steal_card: ^I think Ernst died because he took something he shouldn't have taken.
QGetsDevice: ^The device was passed to an American agent by means of a dead drop.
gamblers_anonymous: ^Ernst tried to get help, but somehow, it would never stick.
InBedWithErnst: ^I did love him. I shouldn't have. But I did.
wedding_drive_away: ^I had never been so happy as the day Ernst and I got married.
wedding: ^That day is one I'd never take back.
monitoring_station: ^Its location remains unknown, but our best evidence suggests the device has indeed been activated.

b: ^"For Q. Keep safe. High enemy interest."
^"I'm very sorry... but we need you to come in and identify your husband's body."
^"I don't want to see this. Move along."
^"Do the drop, and let's get out of here."
^"No time to lose. Back to the border."
^"What's the big fuss, dude? Why'd you get me in here so early?"
^"But a shockwave like that would have toppled a cityblock!"
^"Don't even think about giving it to him."
^"If you're out of chips, sir, you cannot bet."
^"Operation of device observed from California earthquake monitoring station, Jan '61"
^"Found amongst possessions of ER, murder victim."
^"Aug 15th, 1964. Device is removed from protective sheath."
^"Whatever it is, you can trust me, sir."
^"Attempted theft. Killer was disturbed and escaped. Narcotics in victim's blood."
^"KING OF DIAMONDS: cards / slots / roulette / girls"
^"Quentin Roch, Private Investigator. Champs de Mars. No matter too small. Divorce a speciality."
^"Gamblers Anonymous. DON'T GET LUCKY GET HELP."
^A few white grains are still visible on the spoon.
^Containing a few grains of a white powder.
^The back of this card is slightly different from the others.
^Parking receipt for a Blue Chevy, registered to Ernst Richards
^"Paris. May 1968. Device shell found on theft victim's corpse."
^"Ernie - Hold onto this for me. Keep it safe. Q."
^"Suspected handover at UN building around 3 o'clock today."
^"Handover at the Champs du Mars. Midnight tonight. Q."
^"I'll get over to the UN right away, sir."
^"Yes? Do you have something for me?"
^"We are out of time. Montmatre Tunnel. Tonight. 11:30pm"
^"This is excellent cover. You have done very well, Ana. Do not worry. Your reward will come."
^"Well done, comrade. You have our thanks. We will extract you when it is safe."
^"You've made the right decision. I'm glad you've seen what's right here."
^"You are having second thoughts? You wish to be extracted?"
^"You'll need to monitor Roch without him seeing you."
^"My advice, Ana, is to throw yourself back into your work."
^"That phase of your life is over. Time to leave it behind."
^Kitchens of the Hotel de la Tour

ErnDiesEarly: ^I would have been forced to betray him eventually. It's better this way.
